I'm a serial high-tech entrepreneur who has started, financed, grown, and sold companies in the networking and security sectors. Today, I lead and advise high-growth management teams, putting his public company executive management and private company entrepreneurship experience to work. I'm 54, and I live in Newport Beach, California. I hold Bachelors and Masters degrees in Computer Science from the University of Calgary. Experience Venture Advisor, iNovia Capital (http://inovia.vc), 2008 - present. iNovia manages about $1.2 billion in capital across five funds. My role is to work with portfolio companies on strategy, sales, and marketing, and also to review and provide feedback on each investment iNovia makes. VP Security Products, McAfee, 1996-1997 At McAfee (then the 10th largest PC software company in the world), I held responsibility for expanding the company’s offerings beyond anti-virus, to cover the entire network security and encryption sectors. Co-Founder, Launchworks, 1999 I co-founded and sat as a board member of Launchworks, Canada’s highly acclaimed keiretsu-style venture investment house. Launchworks made 11 investments prior to the Internet crash of 2000, and had three successful exits after that crash, including IPO’s of Guest-Tek (the largest in-room Internet provider in the world), 180 Connect (6,000 employees, $400m in revenues, the largest installer of satellite television reception equipment, ultimately sold to DirecTV), and the acquisition by Computer Associates of Control-F1. Co-Founder and CEO, Jasomi Networks, 2001-2005 I co-founded and led Internet telephony equipment provider Jasomi Networks, and grew it into an award- winning multi-million dollar leader in that industry, before it was successfully acquired by Ditech Networks in 2005. Co-Founder and CEO, FSA Corporation, 1989-1996 I founded and grew the company into a profitable, internationally recognized network security product powerhouse serving Fortune 100 companies. Some of its product lines were acquired from 1994-1996 by Unison Tymlabs (now IBM) and Symark Software (now BeyondTrust), and the entire company was acquired in 1996 by McAfee.

Professional with 10+ years silicon valley experience in software architecture, computer systems, High performance computing, cloud computing, security, containers. Contributed as technical leader, architect, hands-on roles at Facebook, Schlumberger, Intel, HP, UIUC, Microsoft. CS PhD from UIUC. B-tech gold medalist from IIT Roorkee. Google Scholar, Github in contact info. Skillset: Some technologies I have worked over the years: - Private and public cloud: Openstack, Kubernetes, Mesos, SDI, KVM, Docker, Google cloud, GCS, GKE, Cloud Endpoints, AWS, Amazon EC2, NFV - Fullstack/Backend/Distributed: scalable microservices, Python Django, Flask, postgressql, auth, Docker, gRPC, protobuf, REST, swagger - Security: "Host security" - SELinux, iptables, Host IDS, Suricata, IMA, Web app firewall (WAF), Intel TxT, Intel CIT, Intel KGT, "Network security" - IPSec, OpenVPN, firewalls, Regex, Network IDS. "Application security" - static and dynamic analysis tools. Container security - Perf optimization, HPC, MPI, OpenMP, shell scripting, C/C++ - Misc: Zabbix, ElasticSearch, Logstash, Kibana (ELK), PubSub, AMQP, CI/CD, Git, Scrum. Education: - PhD and MS rom Univ of Illinois at Urbana Champaign - Computer Science - GPA 4.0. - B.Tech in CS from IIT Roorkee - Gold medalist - GPA: 9.8/10 Current Role: HPC and cloud software architect at Schlumberger Software Technology Innovation center (STIC). Industry Talks: - Sessions at conferences including Openstack Summit, Intel Developer Forum (IDF), DockerCon, MesosCon. - Organizer of HPC Cloud bay area Meetup Papers, talks, Service: - Author of 20+ top conference/journal papers. 550+ citations. Talks, conferences/workshops keynotes - Program committee of conferences/workshops such as IEEE/ACM CCGrid, Middleware. - Reviewer of top IEEE journals -Transactions on Cloud (TCC), TDPS. - NSF panelist reviewer for grants. More at: https://www.linkedin.com/in/abhishekguptauiuc/

Ian Clarke is a Computer Scientist and Entrepreneur, with a track record of both technical and business innovation, and an outspoken thinker and activist on issues relating to freedom of speech, intellectual property law, and technology. Ian is best known as the founder and coordinator of the Freenet Project; designed to allow true freedom of communication, Freenet was the first decentralized anonymous peer-to-peer network, and a precursor of the “distributed hashtable” data structure. Ian has a degree in Artificial Intelligence and Computer Science and has over two decades of expertise applying machine learning to real world problems in areas as diverse as online dating, advertising, petroleum, and fraud detection.

I'm currently a big data systems software architect at Yahoo!. I joined the company via the acquisition of a startup, BrightRoll where I started and led the big data engineering group. My role focused on technology, architecture, technical strategy and execution with the objective of enabling data driven capabilities for the company. We built a highly scalable platform (data pipelines, analytics, data warehouses) that ingests 10s of Terabytes of data per day and processes 10s of Billions of events per day. The major technologies used are Flume, HDFS, M/R, HBase, MySQL, Druid, Redshift, Play Framework, Scala, Java, Ruby. I advise startups in terms of assessing and tackling their technical challenges, aligning their technology with business priorities, and finding a balance between premature optimization and scalability bottlenecks. I provide specific expertise relating to ad tech, big data, architecture, distributed and highly scalable systems, databases, infrastructure and lean/agile execution. Lastly, I provide introductions to investors and other industry experts where appropriate.

I am an Asset Performance Management specialist with hands experience in ASPENTECH, GE & AVIVA APM tools. My strength is Instrumentation & Controls with extensive experience in IIOT, Industry 4 Roll Out, Hazardous Oil & Gas Installations at various Oil Refineries and Petrochemical Plants. I have Implemented Instrumentation Technologies at Mega Refinery and Petro-Chemical Projects and carry the experience of Oil & Gas Process Units & Tank Farm. I have led Instrumentation teams in Implementation of more than hundred Brownfield Reliability Improvement & Maintenance Projects. I carry expertise in design, installation, testing, and maintenance of Control Systems DCS/ESD/PLC/FGS and Field Instrumentation. I have achieved online Migration of several DCS/PLC Systems for Obsolescence Mitigation in Brownfield Units. I carry experience in Process Plant HAZOP, FEED/P&ID Reviews, 3D Model Review, Job Safety Analysis, Root Cause Analysis, FAT/SAT of Control Systems, & Pre-Commissioning Safety Management Audit I have accomplished Sustainable design in Process Functional Safety, Asset Maintenance, Management of Change (MOC), Safety at Work Checklist, SOP for Instrumentation Work, Resource Optimization & Operational Excellence. Leading Instrumentation Planning Role, I have created Maintenance Strategies and MIS for New Plants post Commissioning and delivered Preventive Maintenance Schedules through Maintenance Management Systems ERP / SAP. I have created the roadmap for improvement in Planning & Maintenance of old Refinery units. I have delivered several Strategies for Turnaround in Refinery & Petrochem units. I have standardized Work Management & Procurement Specifications for performance and reliability. I have created QA Checks and Systems Monitoring for working in Oil & Gas Units. I continue to enhance my experience in Metering Systems and Custody Transfer in large scale Petroleum Product Deliveries. I continue to lead Teams of Instrumentation Personnel from diverse backgrounds & play a key role in delivering safe, efficient and reliable plant performance through coaching and development.

Lead Engineer, Founder of WolfPak Labs doing technology consulting and talent incubation company designing and building great products and advising other companies in making the best technology decisions for their company. Full stack engineering working on mobile, front-end web development, back-end development, access control security, scalability, and more. I've worked for companies such as Intuit, CBS Interactive, Salesforce, and mentored companies such as Alumwire. Worked on products such as Quickbooks Desktop, Quickbooks Online, Quickbooks Online Mobile (iPhone, Android, Blackberry), CBSi Video Distribution Infrastructure and Streaming Infrastructure, Authorization / Access Control Security on the Salesforce Platform. Also have experience as a Real Estate Developer and investor building from beginning until end of custom built homes (50+ projects) in Southern California in cities such as San Marino, Arcadia, Huntington Beach, Newport Beach, and other locations.

System and human oriented designer, specialized in service consulting and innovation audit for disruptive projects or prospective strategies. I have worked on projects for start-ups to large corporations. Always aware of the latest trends and technologies and design thinking expert allowing me to bring innovative solutions into collaborations based on trust and quality work. You need an outside perspective, precise advise or niches to explore, you are facing a wall or a blank page? I'm here for your project and will be happy to enter into collaboration with you, contact me !

If the answer is 'yes' to any of them, then you have found the right person: Over the past two decades, GK Palem has been helping CxOs with: + Building high-performance Technology teams + Delivery Management + Scaling the product architectures + Defining long-term and short-term technology vision & Product Roadmaps + Creating growth strategy + Adopting emerging technologies into business processes + Setting up of Centre-of-Excellence (COE) divisions for critical R&D projects https://gk.palem.in/

Aleksey is an experienced entrepreneur and product development executive in the enterprise and cloud space in both large companies and startups, having launched multiple software products and services and led engineering teams both local and offshore. An 7.5 year veteran of Microsoft, Aleksey has held roles in the various departments of Consulting, Developer Evangelism, Engineering and Operations. Most of his roles were technical and product management roles giving him inside-out perspective on how products and services get envisioned. Developed and marketed. One of his last positions was at Yahoo! Inc’s Cloud Platform Group where he was in charge of product management and evangelism activities for compute portion of Yahoo’s private cloud now serving multiple worldwide-leading web services, such as Yahoo Finance and Yahoo News. Prior to this, he managed joint projects between Microsoft and global ISVs developing applications on Windows Azure, Microsoft’s public cloud platform. Most recently, Aleksey has co-founded two startups in B2B space and launched one of them.
